channel.title: Who's waiting for the Steam version?
channel.description:
Instead of downloading the mod directly I'm going to hold out for the Steam version. After waiting 8 years I can handle a few more weeks!
Anyone else?

item.title: Who's waiting for the Steam version?
item.dc:creator: ysrael214
item.description:
My bad, 3/4 of the game is the only one finished

Read full topic

item.source: Who's waiting for the Steam version?

item.title: Who's waiting for the Steam version?
item.dc:creator: IceSage
item.description:
This thread’s as good as any to outright as I guess…

What’s the deal with this not being on Steam?

We pushed HARD for this to be one of the first releases on Greenlight, and it almost was. Instead we get McPixel.

Almost a year later, and it’s not on Steam. What happened? Is something bigger going on? Did VALVe say, “Nah.”

Like, why isn’t this currently a part of Steam… and why is everyone so silent about it?

I keep looking for direct answers on the forums and everywhere else, but all I see is people posting “let’s get this on Steam.”

Okay, great… but what’s the current issue? Some MYSTERIOUS awesomeness between the devs on VALVe, or did people just forget that everyone tried really hard to share the Greenlight page with their friends to make this a reality?

Read full topic
item.source: Who's waiting for the Steam version?

item.title: Who's waiting for the Steam version?
item.dc:creator: t4nith
item.description:
Kazioo:

Houndeye in Dota 2 seems to be based on the model from Black Mesa:
https://www.cyborgmatt.com/2013/04/dota-2-24th-april/#houndeye-courier

Steam release soon?

Not sure about that but am I the only one that read this on that page?

The courier will be bundled in with the upcoming Half-Life 3 release as a preorder bonus

item.title: Who's waiting for the Steam version?
item.dc:creator: elivance
item.description:
Hubicorn:

The ultimate teaser!

k3nny1550:

I wonder if the new version of the mod will use SDK 2009 (since they got on Greenlight and thus entered an NDA with Valve). Of course, I highly doubt that eventuality, and the content could be a major pain in the ass to port, too.

Dear Esther’s devs have paid the 2009 SDK(even though the whole thing it’s under NDA) , I doubt that Valve would give it for free.

item.title: Who's waiting for the Steam version?
item.dc:creator: D3lta
item.description:
elivance:

Hopefully!->Lambda Core Slide-show.

I just wish you were more open with your development.

I know about the NDA but NMRIH devs have choosen to be more open about the development.

The release of the mod is already a big achievement, after 3 fucking years of no updates on their social media feed.I honestly don’t think its needed to post anything Xen related, because most of it will probably spoil a lot.
